title: NixOS Package PRs for qc, spectacle, keepassxc, pipewire, bind-9.18.14, bcache-tools packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for qc, spectacle, keepassxc, pipewire, bind-9.18.14, bcache-tools packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This moves dolphin, dolphin-plugins, and spectacle into the optional packages section of the plasma6 module. These are not necessary for Plasma's operation, and as they're exposed to the user through desktop entries - people may not want them to be strictly required.

It also reorders some dependencies and adds a few lines of documentation about what they're there for.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 24.05 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 and 23.11 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

Add a üëç reaction to pull requests you find important.
items.title: Mark dolphin + spectacle as optional packages in plasma6.nix

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Gate support for the gstreamer-device-provider behind the gstreamerSuppert flag. gstreamer-device-provider requires glib-2.0 as well as all the gstreamer dependences which are only pulled in when gstreamerSupport is enabled.

Resubmitting PR #280736 due to reviewers being added during rebase.

items.title: pipewire: fix build without gstreamer support

items.content_html:
Description of changes

In order to successfully connect bluetooth audio devices, pipewire must be running already which it might not when socketActivation is enabled.
-> disabling socketActivation is a better default as it provides the more stable user experience

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)

items.title: nixos/pipewire: disable socket activation by default

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Since version 2.3.0, fluidsynth includes a pipewire audio driver. In fact, it's configured to build with pipewire driver support by default, but it needs to be able to find libpipewire during configuration of course. This PR just includes libpipewire so nix now builds fluidsynth with the pipewire driver.

(Note: I had hoped that including pipewire.lib in buildInputs would have worked, but only pipewire worked, not pipewire.lib.)

I wasn't able to run nixpkgs-review, since evulation took up so much memory it blew up my 32GB workstation.

Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux

  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.05 Release Notes (or backporting 22.11 Release notes)
